description: Lithuanians are a cavalry civilization that excels in fast and aggressive play, especially in the early game.
dark_age: Start with 4 villagers and a scout.
Build 2 houses, a lumber camp, and a mining camp.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Build a barracks and train 3 militia.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 21-22 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 3-4 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional stables and continue producing cavalry units.
Build a market and blacksmith to upgrade cavalry and sell excess resources for gold.
Research the unique technology, Leitis, for improved cavalry performance.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 800-1000 wood, 500-600 gold, and 400-500 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 10-12 villagers to food, 6-8 to wood, 2-3 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Build a monastery and start training monks.
Research the unique technology, Hill Forts, for improved tower and castle performance.
Build a siege workshop and start producing siege units.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 36-37 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2500-3000 wood, and 2000-2500 gold at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 12-15 to wood, 6-8 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Research the unique technology, Tower Shields, for improved infantry and cavalry pierce armor.
Use siege units to destroy enemy buildings and monks to convert enemy units.
Have around 6000-7000 food, 4000-5000 wood, and 3000-4000 gold in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 10-12 to gold, and 20-25 to stone.
